intro: Tanacetum praecox, commonly known as early tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features finely divided, gray-green leaves with a strong, aromatic scent. Its yellow flowers bloom in early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Tanacetum praecox is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it has been used historically in herbal medicine.
